title: I would honestly prefer Surrender vote deleted or active later
body:
for a long time now i am getting people giving up at 5 mins ish and demanding a FF at 15 .... focus on this point is not to win but to just go next game ... 

when it gets to 15 i always say no to FF because i always try for comebacks but this vote... i say no and some people ecide to just grief to end the game faster ....

Even when we can have a vayne kayle or veigar ... a hard late game comp it doenst matter we must FF... >_>

replies.body: People are still going to give up regardless if surrender vote is a thing or not.

Surrender vote makes it easier and more likely to give up, though.

If it's an easy and acceptable option, people are more likely to take it.

Honestly? I'm in favor of removing it outright. It being there is too much of a temptation and helps lead to people giving up, which leads to a *mental* aspect of snowballing.

Sure, it'd lead to an increase in people opening mid, but it'd almost certainly lead to a decrease in overall giving up.

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RldRxiy7,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-11-24T01:18:51.019+0000)
>
> Honestly? I'm in favor of removing it outright. It being there is too much of a temptation and helps lead to people giving up, which leads to a *mental* aspect of snowballing.
> 
> Sure, it'd lead to an increase in people opening mid, but it'd almost certainly lead to a decrease in overall giving up.

Surrender should be disabled unless the gold difference is over a certain scaling threshold. Even in matches over 20 minutes.

All surrender vote does is demotivate people, and makes people give up too early.

If games are basically over by 15 minutes, the meta is the issue (riot) or your team getting massively outplayed or outpicked, in whixh case theres still open mid, which people already do.
I'd be down with a forced minimum threshold. Require being down a certain number of turrets and gold, though, not just gold.

Being down turrets doesn't matter.

You can literally not take a single turret and if you hold out 30 minutes, win the game off one teamfight. 

What does turrets really have to do with anything? They're gold. If the enemy takes them and you've taken none, then you're just at a recoverable gold deficit, the exception being turret plating and first tower gold. 

Adding a turret difference just seems arbitrary.
Removing turrets exposes that jungle area and increases mobility. THEORETICALLY the turret represents a safe spot to run to, which extends control of the map.

Removing turrets has no impact on mobility lmao. What?

Also, turrets have no impact on jungle. 

The only thing turrets offer is a safe spot, vision, and a place to bounce minion waves off of. And gold not in the enemy's hands. 

_______________________

Think about it this way: What's stopping me from invading your jungle if your turret is down? Nothing. What's stopping me from invading your jungle if your turret isn't down? Also nothing. Its your top/jungler/mid/bot. Their position farming on the map is the only relevance to this. 

If you're down in turrets, it also means you have a much closer place to bounce minion waves off of and farm safer. The enemy does not get this luxury. They're forced to buy control wards to push up safely. The same for being down an inhibitor. That's extra gold/exp for the team that's -1 inhib, and it will ALWAYS be pushing into them hard, which means the enemy can't freeze it from you. 

This is all assuming the game isn't a stomp, because in that case its the gold that's holding you back...not turrets. 

A lot of things that are seen as 'advantages' are actually disadvantageous as opposed to simply denying more exp/gold to the enemy team while absorbing more for yourself if you aren't far enough ahead to roll over them, or aren't taking other objectives off of it. This is provided your team is overall playing correctly in response to losing those objectives, also provided your team scales at all.

What do turrets have to do with anything?

Well, for starters, they're one of the things you *must* destroy to end the game...

Yeah, but 5 turrets is the difference between your nexus being completely exposed and still having all 3 inhib turrets. 

What benchmarks would you set for turrets? Not all turrets are equal.

Removing outright means the following possibilities:

Losing players int to end the game
Winning players refuse to end and spawnkill the losing team (remember those premades that legit made game last for hours and threatened to report the non premades if they left? fun times, let's make every game like that except you don't even need premades on both teams, just a trolling winning team.)
Losing players just straight up afk

1 and 3 are definite downsides to removing it. But 2 is less of a worry, because they run the risk of throwing the match then. The one game where people were actually held hostage is definitely a special case, because that also prevented that throw possibility.
